metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29975 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Through a series of DOM manipulations, a message, over which the attacker had control of the text but not HTML or formatting, could be overlaid on top of another domain (with the new domain correctly shown in the address bar) resulting in possible user confusion. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 90.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29975` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 90.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '90.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
